page.title: 10The Forge
page.content: Mr Swindon is Mattersey's blacksmith and farrier. His grandfather was the blacksmith before him. Mr Swindon was 15 years old when he started, the first 5 years working for a man in Tuxford followed by 11 years working for himself. He works 8 hours a day and shoes about 20-25 horses a week. He makes about 4000 shoes a year. For the village he has made the church gates, weather vane to the old vicarage, and the gate and railings to the cemetery. He makes most of his tools but some of them are bought such as his gas, anvils and clippers. He works to a 30 mile radius, sometimes travelling in the van.
